results.title: Earl of Home
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and British Information Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Commonwealth Teleview”.
In an interview with Robert McKenzie, the Earl of Home, Britain’s Secretary of State for Commonwealth Relations, discusses present and future trends of the British Commonwealth and talks about some of the links and common aims that bind this family of nations together.

results.title: Eagles on the ranges (Aquila audax)
results.creator_credit: Frank Paul Muscolino and Australian Wildlife Video & Documentaries
results.brief_description: A sequel to “Where eagles nest” this is a study of twin young eagles which form part of a group of seven eagles born over three breeding seasons. Beginning with the twin chicks in their nest under the protective eye of their mother, we follow a progressive journey of the chicks as they become young eagles fending for themselves and taking their first hesitant attempts at flight. Filmed on the north-east side of the Great Dividing Range in the “Valley of a Thousand Hills”, on the watershed of the Yea River, the King Parrot Creek and the Strath Creek through to the foot of Mount Tallarook and Upper Goulburn River in Victoria, Australia, Frank Muscolino’s cinematography provides close-up and in some cases, extremely rare and hard to get footage, of these magnificent birds in flight, swooping and soaring as they hunt for food. Also includes footage of such native animals as kangaroos, koalas and cockatoos. With minimal commentary, background music and the sounds of nature, this is an interesting film, particularly for bird lovers. Narrator: Rod Cook.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Paul Muscolino and Australian Wildlife Video & Documentaries

results.title: Eager to write: Lorraine Wilson
results.creator_credit: Andrew Scollo and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: Dicusses the ways in which children learn to write and how children who find writing difficult can be encouraged and taught. Features many of the ideas of Lorraine Wilson.

results.title: Eadweard Muybridge: zoopraxographer
results.creator_credit: Thom Andersen and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description: Documents the pioneering photographic work of Eadweard Muybridge (1830-1904) in which he rigorously analysed human and animal motion. Muybridge’s multiple camera techniques and his projection device, the zoopraxiscope, were technical curiosities unnecessary for the development of the modern motion picture but through them he overcame a philosophical obstacle. He demonstrated empirically that the infinite flux of time could be reconstructed from a finite number of photographs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Thom Andersen and University of California, Los Angeles

results.title: Each man's son
results.brief_description: A story in which the doctor in a small Cape Breton coal-mining community solves an emotional conflict as he administers to a boy whose hands have been mangled in a needless accident. Based on an excerpt from the Hugh MacLennan novel Each Man’s Son. Cast: Tom McBride, Jack Zolov (Award: Yorkton)

results.title: Each day that comes
results.creator_credit: Graham Parker, Julian Biggs and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A glimpse into the nature of loneliness. Frances Hyland plays the part of a small-town girl who enjoys position and respect in her community as the owner of a successful dress shop, but who wonders if marriage might not have been a better choice. Disturbed by thoughts of what might have been, she resolves to live each day as it comes. (Award: Melbourne) Cast includes: Frances Hyland, William Needles and Kate Reid

results.title: Each child is different
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Elementary School Teacher Education”.
Dramatised incidents are used in presenting a study of five fifth-grade children, whose personalities and backgrounds present typical problems. The film explains the importance of the elementary school teacher’s knowledge of the complex and different backgrounds of the children, as well as their individual abilities and needs, in order to adjust the teaching program to meet these needs.
